item.title: On taking notes and learning methods
item.description: After finishing the book “How to take smart notes” by SÃ¶nke Ahrens, I came to realize the following: I have been exposed to two ways to learn that use notes as a basis of the system. The first is embodied by the Zettlekasten and depicted through Ahrens’ book. The second relies on spaced repetition and Ankification of notes if you will. It is only natural to question myself which way (if any at all) I have found best suited for me.
